title: Inbox corruption getting worse
content:
A few days ago I posted here that my inbox was corrupt. At that time most of the December incoming emails were spoiled and inaccessible.

Now the failure has spread back all the way to the beginning of the inbox -- incoming emails from 2017 and 2018 which I had kept there for lack of a better place to put them.

What can I do? Other than stop using Thunderbird?! I am on Beta, would it help to go to the normal version?

How would I do that?

I have lost hundreds of incoming emails, valuable ones by definition (i.e. because I chose to keep them).

I am using 1220b1 (32-bit) in Windows 10.
creator: mctangora

title: emails

creator: leann08

title: Tools disappearing from mail window.
content:
Seemly randomly, my tools disappear from the top of my mail window. The only way I have figured out to get them back is to quit and re-open Thunderbird. I have only one add-on and one theme active. Turning them off doesn't change anything. It's not a critical issue, just annoying. But if there's a solution, I'd love to know!

This is a relatively recent development... since the last update, I think. But it's happening at least once a day, often more.
creator: lotsofjoy

title: Former ISP interfering with new email
content:
Thunderbird is not to blame. We left Windstream in June. We now have AT&T. We use Outlook email addresses. From July until last week, we were still receiving Windstream emails and had gradually been telling everyone to use the new Outlook addresses.

Now Windstream is insistent that we give them a password. Typing in the only password we know is not working. I can often click cancel and move on, however Windstream is now locking Thunderbird up so I have to use Task Manager and restart.

After all this time, we really do not need to continue receiving emails through Windstream. We did fine with setting up the new Outlook addresses, but we are clueless on disabling the old Windstream addresses.

As you see this is not really a Thunderbird problem, but I am hoping that someone can help anyway.
creator: EastTenn

title: Inbox icon only visible when scrolling left all the way. Should it not be visible all the time?
content: To show inbox icon for listing all emails I have to scroll left on the bar that lists each individual email. Most annoying. How do I geet the inbox incon visible ALL the time?

title: Configure Thunderbird SMTP settings
content:
I am assisting my friend Lindsay in aged care to enable him to continue to use Thunderbird for email. Currently TB will receive mail but unable to send.

This is complicated in that Lindsay is paying iPrimus.com.au a monthly fee to enable him to use an old email address xx@bluep.com. I can log in to the iPrimus web portal to send and receive xx@bluep.com emails, https://webmail.iprimus.com.au/?_task=mail&_mbox=INBOX.

I downloaded Thunderbird version 115.6.0 (64-bit) on my pc this morning and the Auto Set Up configured mail.bluep.com as the incoming (POP) and outgoing (SMTO) servers. Mail is coming in but not sending.

I changed the outgoing server to smtp.iprimus.com.au, default port 587 however messages still cannot be sent and Thunderbird shows that smtp settings must be reconfigured.

I spoke this morning to iPrimus Tech Support who advised the default smtp port should be 25, not 587. However I have found that resetting the smtp port to 25 does not enable emails to send.

Note that I have previously set the smtp port to 587 which enabled sending on non ISP connections. This ability would be required as Lindsay is using whatever Wi-Fi service is available in the facility.

iPrimus Tech Support have suggested I should contact Thunderbird (Mozilla) about this problem.

Can you advise Thunderbird server settings for this situation.

Thanks for you assistance. Regards, Peter M
creator: peter_maddock

title: TB sees my Gmail acct folders but not my Comcast acct folder nor does it delete on Comcast
content: FB can see and delete in my Gmail acct but sees no Comcast folders and does not delete mail I want deleted. I have to manually go to the Comcast site and delete mail. The old Win Mail app (may it rest peace) did both.
creator: 1768gm

title: All email on Thunderbird disappeared
content: I opened my email on Thunderbird and all emails, folders etc are gone for all three email address. The email addresses are in the drop down box and when I drop them down their is a small envelope with a tiny lock on the lower right corner of the envelope. How do I restore all emails, folders etc for these three email addresses?
creator: grady3

title: Threads
content:
I tried to read all the messages about THREADS but gave up trying to understand if there is a solution. I have always sorted all my email by DATE. Newest at the top. I use FOLDERS for sorting names or subjects I correspond with.

I want all my email in all my folders to sort by DATE. I missed seeing a lot of messages when THREADS became part of Thunderbird. Now I have to look all over the place if every new email I get is sent as a response to a previous email. Before all new email was at the top. Now it is everywhere within a folder and it takes me way too much time to keep looking for the latest emails.

Is there any way to just turn THREADS off without loosing the ability to see ALL emails.

Thanks.
creator: FredBerney

title: Thunderbird - rychlý filtr
content:
Dobrý den, obracím se na Vás prosbou o radu s nastavení rychlého filtru. Mám dva počítače, jeden v práci a notebook. V práci při zadání textu do rychlého filtru a změně (v levém sloupci) účtu nebo místní složky zůstane zadaný text v rychlém filtru. Pokud to samé udělám na notebooku, text se z pole rychlého filtru ztratí a musím při změně účtu nebo výběru jiné místní složky text do rychlého filtru znovu zadat. Myslím, že jsem tuto volbu někde v nastaveni kdysi zadával, ale nyní toto nemohu najít.

Děkuji moc za radu a přeji krásný den

Petr Štrunc strunc.azfinance@seznam.cz
creator: strunc.azfinance

title: Unthreaded sort keeps getting overridden
content: This last update made some annoying changes to Thunderbird. Most I can live with, but one I cannot. Immediately after the last update, Thunderbird started overriding my preferred sort setting for email which is "unthreaded". I do NOT read emails by threads. I read them chronologically. Yet every single time I select View > Sort by > Unthreaded, within a few days (and this last time in less than 24 hours and while I was reading an email!!), this setting gets overridden and my email view goes back to threaded. How do I make this stop?

title: Import Profiles in Thunderbird
content:
Liebe Mozilla Spezialisten, ich brauche dringend Hilfe - mein Firefox und Thunderbird waren nicht mehr zu starten.

Nachdem alle Versuche scheiterten habe ich beide Apps neu installiert - alles ok, aber ohne meine Profildaten. Die Dateien habe ich aus den Sicherungen, kann sie aber mit vielen Versuchen nicht mit den Programmen verbinden. Die Hilfetexte zu diesem Thema bringen mich nicht weiter - ich soll die Altdaten in die neuen Profile einkopieren - finde aber keine Unterkataloge in den Neuinstallationen.

Ich brauche mindestens in Thunderbird / Firefox 

meine umfangreichen Adressdaten und die Kalenderdaten

und in Firefox die Passwortdatei mit Benutzernamen und die Passwörter. Wo finde ich die neuen Profildateien und ist die kpl. Datei mit Namen oder sind nur die enthaltenen Dateien in das neue Profil einzu kopieren. Mit den Daten betreue ich drei Vereine und stehe sehr unter Zeitdruck. Ich bitte um baldige Hilfe und Tipps um wieder arbeiten zu können. Mozillaticket 126436 Mailadresse ist h-w.decker@outlook.de, Tel. 08131-81925. Danke.
creator: h-w.decker
